hypothesis_content.title: Japan Rate Hike FUD Creates Asymmetric Short-Term Volatility Spike Opportunity
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when a macro catalyst (e.g., Japan rate hike news) triggers a sharp, high-volume BTC drop below a key psychological level (e.g., $85K), implied volatility (IV) will spike disproportionately more than realized volatility (RV) over the next 24-48 hours, creating a profitable short-volatility entry after the initial panic.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often see exaggerated volatility reactions to news as directional conviction is low. The 'scarier macro catalyst' headline amplifies fear, but without a fundamental regime shift, IV tends to overshoot. The $600M liquidation headline creates a self-referential fear loop that decays quickly.
entry_conditions: BTC 1H candle closes >2.5% below prior day's low on volume >150% of 20-day average
Deribit BTC 1-month ATM IV spikes >15 volatility points within 4 hours of news

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price breaks below -8% from entry, confirming bearish regime shift

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: IV continues climbing alongside price decline for >48 hours, indicating sustained deleveraging/panic rather than transient spike.
